website_summaries.verdict: Its ability to automatically map multiple rooms and proficiency for grabbing pet hair makes the 960 a valuable long-term investment.
pros: Has 5 times the suction power of a Roomba 600
Lingers in high-traffic areas for a deeper clean
cons: The ability to track where it vacuums via its companion app would be nice

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: My housekeeper vacuums the living room every other week, but here is what 10 minutes of the Roomba picked up. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Ann Schmidt-fogarty

customer_reviews.title: Clean House
customer_reviews.text: I saved for this model and I'm so glad I did. We named him "Rick". Rick is awesome! He has learned our house and has become very efficient. We have a Golden Retriever that sheds constantly. We run Rick three times a week and the hair on the floor has all but disappeared. Rick is so easy to clean and maintain. The app tells you when. Rick also maps your house and posts a cleaning map of where he cleaned that session. Just amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Jon Todd

customer_reviews.title: I don't know how it got in but not smart enough to get out
customer_reviews.text: After tried 5 times, I return it. The robot did not pick up all the dirt around the edge of the house. It also kept getting stuck under the chairs. I don't know how it got in but not smart enough to get out. Then 2 out of 3 times it just stopped and not returning back to its charger like it suppose to. The sad thing that I have to spent $55 for shipping it back. I hope I don't have to pay restocking fee too. That will be even worst because to try a product less than 2 weeks and pay a ton.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Le

customer_reviews.title: While a great concept, I find this product extremely lacking in ...
customer_reviews.text: While a great concept, I find this product extremely lacking in performance. Basically, if you have multiple people with long hair in your household, the rollers at the bottom of the Roomba (along with the rotating brush) will choke off by winding up wads of hair. I essentially have to intervene by taking it all apart on a weekly basis. I just expect better design from such an expensive product - in the time that I spend working on the Roomba, I could easily vacuum all of those same areas. It also can't do thicker rugs period. If I could get my money back, I would.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Cullen

customer_reviews.title: Roomba.  Dead on Arrival.  Currently an expensive doorstop.
customer_reviews.text: Was supposed to arrive with a partial charge and ready to run as soon as I pulled the battery tab. I did pull the tab, and.... nothing. I let it recharge for about 24 hours, and.... nothing. Completely Dead on Arrival. So I've got some serious questions about quality control. The roomba this is replacing also ended up having charging issues. This is really looking like a trend to me. And this is one expensive doorstop I've currently got. Will update once replaced. Update: product returned but Amazon wouldn't exchange so refund only. Based on what I had a terrible product and fairly poor customer service from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: K. Nygard

customer_reviews.title: Sad face for customer service
customer_reviews.text: Sadly this won't charge anymore after only 4 months and 22 uses. Customer support sent a new charger, but still won't work and they want us to send it in to be fixed. I'm disappointed. For the price we paid I would expect to be shipped a new one, and a prepaid shipping label to send the old one back for them to refurbish. We have a baby on the way and this was my savior from having to vacuum. Very disappointed :(
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: Love it when it works property!
customer_reviews.text: iRobot Roomba 960 worked like a charm the first four months. Since then it stops in the middle of a cycle with no error messages or notices in the app. Tech support has had me reset the machine twice and remove the battery once. Each time the robot runs good for about 4 days and then starts to act up again. I have always cleaned my contacts & sensors and empty the bin after each use. Contact today 11-11-17, tech support said if it acts up again it will need a new battery. For the price of my iRobot ($600) I think they need to send me a new one - I believe I got a lemon.
customer_reviews.author: gram

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Roomba, I bought a Roomba 550 eight years ago that is still working strongly with need of some minor repairs. The new 960 Roomba is better than the 550 Roomba. It starts according to its program, goes to every room and cleans diligently, after the job is done sends me a map of where it has cleaned. The only problem that I have is the battery life. I believe manufacturer sent me an old battery. it works for only15 minutes, then goes for recharge for about half an hour, then starts again, because of this, it takes about six hours to vacuum just one floor (2000 sq ft.)
customer_reviews.author: J. Parvaneh

customer_reviews.title: Not very smart for a smart vac look else where
customer_reviews.text: this company has been around for years and i was hoping that 17 years after my first one i would be wowed but it was the opposite I ordered the roborock s5 and it is way better the mapping is better and i don't have to purchase multiple gadgets to tell the unit where not to go on the roborock its all in the app just the boundaries or lines on the map on the app and bam it won't go there not extra equipment needed. roomba for as long as you have been making this things even the most expensive 1200 dollar unit is no match for the 500 dollar roborock.
customer_reviews.author: Dro Esco

customer_reviews.title: We went from dingy hard wood floors with hundreds of dirty footprints to a sparkling clean floor that glows
customer_reviews.text: Oh my goodness is this thing ever incredible! I have it scheduled to clean every night after midnight and I wake up each morning to a clean floor. You have no idea how filthy your floors are until you own one of these. By saving me the time of sweeping, it frees me up to steam clean my floors every three days. We went from dingy hard wood floors with hundreds of dirty footprints to a sparkling clean floor that glows. Taking away one star because it gets stuck more than I was expecting. We have barstool seating in the kitchen and it gets suck on the metal base every night, plus on random objects.
customer_reviews.author: Deacon Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Dust mite allergy sufferers beware
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this roomba because it was advertised as being good for pet hair and allergens. After doing more research I realized the filter in the roomba is not a true HEPA filter, and therefore doesn't capture dust mite waste (smaller than the dust mites themselves), which is what our dog is very allergic to. I contacted iRobot support and they confirmed they do not make any HEPA filter, nor do they have any affiliate companies that can provide a compatible HEPA filter. I spent $500+ on a roomba and I am back to vacuuming by hand 2 hours each weekend because this roomba makes dust mite allergies worse.
customer_reviews.author: Julia

customer_reviews.title: A $547.00 WTH?!
customer_reviews.text: I paid $547.00 for this robotic vacuum. They sent me what I can assume was someone else’s reject. This thing was dirty, scratched up, dented, missing parts, trash container was cracked. I mean WTH? This is what you get for that kind of money. I mean the instructions were printed out and staples together. I just don’t it. I returned it and ask for a replacement. I’m so disappointed with this experience.
customer_reviews.author: FloridaGirl

customer_reviews.title: I had to return this item. The I robot ...
customer_reviews.text: I had to return this item. The I robot would shut off every time it bumped into a piece of furniture and would display an error message. I tried resetting and reprogramming but it continued.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Good

customer_reviews.title: Performance doesn't touch Neato
customer_reviews.text: Performance doesn't touch Neato. We will be returning and switching back. The Roomba cleaning pattern is chaotic and inefficient. It had to charge twice and still didn't finish cleaning our house. The 2 days we tried it, it was unable to finish cleaning both times due to getting stuck(in a spot Neato never had a problem with) and having to charge so frequently. The areas it did clean were not left as clean as with our previous Neato.
customer_reviews.author: T. Tappy

customer_reviews.title: Roomba roams can cleans amazingly.
customer_reviews.text: Like: Roomba gets into the bottom of beds and picks up dust and hair that normally is hard to get with regular upright vacuum cleaner. It is thorough and tries to cover the entire level of the floor. It even crawls over a threshold of almost 3/8 of an inch. When it is low in battery (about 1.5 hour of work), it goes back to its base to recharge and then resumes. Dislike: Not a lot but it is kinda noisy although not more noisier than an upright. However, no one will run an upright for 1.5 hours nonstop. My floor is 800 sq ft and the roomba takes 3+ hours to clean with one pit stop to recharge.
customer_reviews.author: P. Mok

customer_reviews.title: Really needs a handle!
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from the 880 that I used for years. It's better in that it methodically runs back and forth, and maps out the room, but the 960 is difficult to move around. It's designed to be totally automatic (go home by itself), but that actually happens only about half the time. We have a full house, and the roomba kind of dominates the space, so we manage it by putting it behind a door etc. I dropped it yesterday and had to bend the bumper back to where it was supposed to be. Why did they lose the handle on this design?
customer_reviews.author: TravisFW

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: For surface cleaning only. Only fair suction. Bought another vacuum for doing it right. The hair gets all tangled in the brush always having to take it apart and clean the brush and filter. Just wanders about no recall for where it has been. I wish I wouldn't have purchased it needs to go on ebay.
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: Would not go back to charger unless 6 feet away
customer_reviews.text: I bought 960 instead 980 because the deference is the carpet cleaning power for the 980. I was tricked with this product The reason I went with this product because of the self docking but I found out it sel dock only when it’s 6 feet away from the charger , if the battery goes low and it’s more than 6 feet away it will shut down in middle of the House . The other thing you can’t tell the device what room to clean or what part of the house . It cleans but it’s not like what you see
customer_reviews.author: Zaid Alazawi

customer_reviews.title: It does okay but would picked different brand
customer_reviews.text: Roomba is okay. But honestly had I researched more would have chosen something else. For me the friction spots are primarily in the lack of ability to guide the roomba. You have to buy these little towers, at the time of review a pack of 2 is $70+, and it will either block an entryway or keep roomba at like a 2-3ft radius from the tower. The roomba like to get stuck under the couch and requires intervention to fix. Don’t get me wrong it’s revolutionized my cleaning ritual but I would have chosen a different brand. The self-emptying model if you have the money is probably worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Heron Navarro

customer_reviews.title: but the smart features do not work
customer_reviews.text: The products "Smart Features" do not work. Primarily due to the app. The Tech Support is Foreign and can hardly speak English, they cannot answer simple questions such as "Do you have a known issues list for phones?" I tell them the name of the phone and after 5 minutes they say "oh its not an Iphone"... Pathetic Customer Service / Tech Support / Overall Product.
customer_reviews.author: Garrett Clark

customer_reviews.title: Great vac but needs lots of light
customer_reviews.text: First off this beats me having to spend the time vacuuming....but it could do a better job....mind you, it is not all the fault of the vacuum...it's when I run it. What I didn't know when I purchased it was that it needs a fair amount of light to do a great job. That is fine most of the time, but with covid19 and everyone being home....I'm running it at night...well that doesn't do nearly a good of a job. But still no plans to replace any time soon.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Roomba 900 series — do not expect to recharge, as it says in the marketing material!
customer_reviews.text: We got the 900 series of Roomba by iRobot because this unit goes back and recharges itself when it is low on charge energy. Not so, as we found out. When it is low, it moves around aimlessly (although it did recognize the Wi-Fi network very well) and then it stops. We went further for three days and took the Roomba back to the charger, allowing it to full charge. Next time the same happened, and so on. Of course we had to return it. WE did read about this issue, but we did not think it is possible.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Lander

customer_reviews.title: Dustbin broke in 1st two months!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this and i did for the first month, then the dustbin fastener didn't click into place. I was okay manually closing it, but then the fastener broke off before I had even used it for two months. I had an older model of the roomba for years until it finally stopped taking a charge. I bought this newer, improved model to replace it and it was very pricey to be made so cheaply. I decided I would just order another dustbin only to find out that a replacement dustbin is $188!!!! You can buy the Deebot which works great for the price of the dustbin!
customer_reviews.author: Laura Thatcher

customer_reviews.title: I’ll never be without one of these again. Best thing of my 2020 so far!
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know how I ever lived without these. I’ll never buy another vacuum. The time I’ve wasted vacuuming floors I now spend doing real life things and can get so much more done with CLEAN FLOORS all the time! This thing is worth every penny. I have it scheduled to run every evening and I wake up to clean floors every day. It is a bit noisy, banging around some but, and it gets stuck on occasion but my phone notifies me. It’s only not made it back to its charger a couple times while learning my house map. My OCD has been pleased!
customer_reviews.author: mua4stars

customer_reviews.title: Are you kidding me? I was just woken up ...
customer_reviews.text: Are you kidding me? I was just woken up in the middle of the night by “please charge your Roomba” over and over again and apparently there is no way to turn the sound off.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Powerful cleaning.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second roomba and I upgraded to this version and it really cleans better then my other old version. I like the strength and that it maps out were it has been and if you have a larger house it will go to base and recharge and then pick up were it left off. The only thing I really dont care for is the sencesrs on the dust bin get dusty and says the bin is full when sometimes it's not. Just wipe them clean every time you empty. I think what makes this pick up dirt so well is the brushes spin toward each other.
customer_reviews.author: steph

customer_reviews.title: Love it but still have to vacuum a little and it gets stuck constantly
customer_reviews.text: I really like my roomba. It keeps my apartment clean between weekly deep cleans but by no means would I say get this as your solution to keep you space clean constantly. It can't get certain spaces, like corners or nooks very easily and has a tendency to get stuck sometimes. You can buy the beacons but that's a lot to spend on an invisible barrier for a vacuum. My friend purchased an off brand vacuum and it actually does just as good of a job and is a vacuum and mop in one. If I could go back in time I may have bought the off brand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love me some Roomba. We got 2 (one for each floor)
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome and it's wonderful that the new one tells you if it's stuck and shows you where it goes. This model definitely runs more intelligently as it cleans. I do wish it would send a distress signal on where it is when stuck. As we have to go Roomba hunting. Would be awesome to have an option to have the roomba beep or something from the app. The app is great and this newer model is much better at redocking than the 660 and 860 we had before. That was annoying. This does re-dock to recharge and then go back out as advertised. I was wrong before thinking it didn't do that.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Okerholm

customer_reviews.title: It won't charge
customer_reviews.text: I'm so disappointed. I expected this $500++ machine to be my friend for more than 4 months! It won't charge. I've even cleaned the contact points with alcohol on a cotton ball. I have to fuss with it and fuss with it to get it to charge, and sometimes even then the charging shuts off the moment I turn my back. I have to fuss with it so much that I may as well just sweep my floors myself. Why????? Adding to this review a month or so later... still, I HATE THIS THING! Way, way WAY overpriced, and you have to fuss with it constantly. So angry about this! What a rip-off!!!
customer_reviews.author: Dragonfly

customer_reviews.title: Hair clumps everywhere
customer_reviews.text: Don’t buy this if you have pets. It leaves clumps of hair everywhere. I upgraded from a 675 and I will definitely be going back to that or trying a different brand altogether. Super disappointed. I thought I was crazy, but I tired to use this after using a Dyson upright for the first day, then used Roomba for the subsequent 5 days and clumps everywhere. Horrible product
customer_reviews.author: Bridget Campbell

customer_reviews.title: A Mind of Her Own . . .
customer_reviews.text: The Roomba does fairly well when supervised. She needs constant guidances to stay on track and not simple do a forward and reverse track with few results. Despite setting up the parameters and the little "Make a Line Sensor" she continually goes off from room to room without finishing any one of them before running out of battery. Also jumps up onta a very high pile carpet and gets jammed until she runs out of battery (again despite the sensor being active.) Although the sensor prevents a couple of attempts, the Roomba wins and gets up on the high den rug and dies.
customer_reviews.author: Gwyny

customer_reviews.title: Build quality is better than my previous Neato
customer_reviews.text: Apparently all Roomba's have an issue with dark colored surfaces such as a black rug. The ledge sensor thinks any dark patch is a ledge and refuses to go over it. So if you have anything with a black border or god forbid a black rug, no Roomba will work on it without being self-modified. Build quality is better than my previous Neato. But ledge detection is a deal breaker. Overall I feel robot vacuums are too full of compromises and do not justify the price. Will return this after running into dark surface issue.
customer_reviews.author: swu

customer_reviews.title: Terrible customer service and product
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely terrible product and Amazon will not return after 34 days. I was trying to give it a chance but it’s just completely inconsistent with cleaning areas and dirt. It does not have good suction and frequently misses areas. We tried a number of things to help it out and still not a good enough cleaner. Unfortunately, am proceeding with charge back given dissatisfaction and Amazons inability to work with me on return. IRobot offers 60 day money back guarantee so why won’t Amazon honor this? For how much we spend, they should be more willing to work with us. Very disappointed and will be taking our business elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Katie S.

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Our home is 90% tile. Suction is poor... leaves loose small grass particles on tile very often. . We clean after every use, but Roomba often stops shortly after beginning to clean, returns to base and reads as dirty, bin is nearly empty and clean. I would not purchase this product again, very seldom completes a cleaning cycle without some issue. As far as suctioning, this thing is basically a light duster. Takes me less time to vacuum the house with our Shark, which performs a much superior job.
customer_reviews.author: Michael D. Henry

customer_reviews.title: Maps the room but doesn’t follow the map.
customer_reviews.text: This Roomba does a decent job. It is advertised to map the room, which it does. The problem is that it doesn’t actually follow the map. You have to buy a more expensive model for it to use the map. Useless feature on this model.
customer_reviews.author: Perry Wilson

customer_reviews.title: MUST have hardwoods to use Roomba 960
customer_reviews.text: Everything had two stars because we never got to use it the first time. I wish I had known that the docking station and charging station CAN NOT BE SET UP AND PLACED ON CARPET. I don’t have enough hardwood floors that are close enough to our WI-FI without plugging it into the areas that are in plain view of key rooms whenever someone comes in our front door. I just wish I had known that before ordering it. Now it has to go back.
customer_reviews.author: Georgia Peach Sherry

customer_reviews.title: Not happy with the product
customer_reviews.text: I owed a mooso smart bacuum a lot more cheaper than this one, and it did a better job than this one.. that cleaning bin is super annoying since is almost never full and calls it out to be empty.. is dirt it will get dirty, taking out the one brush to clean it is super inconvenience also, Super disappointing on this roomba i though it was going to be bad ass, also once it maps your floor it will only pass by one spot once.. in auto mode i though mu cheaper robot in the pass did a much better job than this one.. will give the shark a chance
customer_reviews.author: Abraham Palacios

customer_reviews.title: Excellent choice
customer_reviews.text: We really love our Roomba. It doe what it is supposed to do and it does it pretty well. PROS: pretty thorough job of vacuuming, gets under furniture, desks, and tables easily, relatively quiet and noiseless. CONS: Can be a little temperamental with filters require cleaning almost after every use. Have your error code list handy when it announces one. Aside from this, we recommend it. For what it does, the little issues are relatively minor.
customer_reviews.author: BowHunter60

customer_reviews.title: There was an initial disappointment quickly remedied
customer_reviews.text: The operation of the robot is truly jaw-dropping. We have used it three times to date. While it outperforms my own vacuuming, so far it hasn't saved me time since I am compelled to watch with awe regarding the level of technology! I'm sure this will pass. There was an initial disappointment quickly remedied. Our first unit seemed to become confused about two thirds through the first cleaning. Roomba was immediately available by phone and directed a few tests and asked a few questions. It was soon determined that a replacement was required. I received the replacement within a week and returned the original. Now, everything is operating much better than anticipated.
customer_reviews.author: SteveS

customer_reviews.title: Nice attempt but completely useful
customer_reviews.text: Having purchased this unit over three months ago, I have a pretty good feel for its capabilities or lack of. The simple fact is in all the time I have owned it with well over 40 cycles, the vacuum has not completed a vacuum cycle yet. The biggest gripe is when the trash bin gets full, no matter how quickly I empty it, the cycle is cancelled and incomplete. When I restart it, it goes over the same area already cleaned....not really as helpful as I would have hoped.
customer_reviews.author: P. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Great cleaning machine
customer_reviews.text: We have a 2 dogs, and one is a German Shepherd (AKA German Shedder). This vacuum helps us stay ahead of the hair without us having to push a heavy vacuum around every day. We've had this machine since before XMAS, and we use it around our whole house. We use it on our main floor most every day, and we frequently relocate it to our finished (i.e. carpeted) walkout basement to vacuum there, as well. It picks up hair well, and it does a nice job of working out occasional dog prints on the carpet (GSD's have big dirt-collecting paws).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: If you don't have a Roomba, you need one.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my tiled floors. I have 2 of the next level up for carpet. I've used the Roombas for years and they keep getting better. I highly recommend for hardwood or tiled floors. We set it to run every other day (we have 3 German shepherds and a lot of hair) and it covers the entire area. we have it set up for. I really like the map that's available in the app because it shows that the Roomba is getting everything. I like that it follows the map and doesn't simply run rampant until the battery runs dead. It recharges and continues if it hasn't finished the entire area.
customer_reviews.author: Always Reading

customer_reviews.title: Dissapointed
customer_reviews.text: I tried to use this robot on my main floor but it was not capable of cleaning my area rugs. One was too high and couldn't climb on it and the other two have dark edges and detect them as clifts. Other features, like pet hair, no tangle, and floor mapping are great. I used the robot on the second floor and worked great, I do not have area rugs, the only issue was to transition to the laundry room, seems the threshold is too high for it. I am thinking of returning this item.
customer_reviews.author: PF

customer_reviews.title: Not for everyone, But it is for me.
customer_reviews.text: We are senior and live on a one level floor. This little vacuum makes the whole home look cleaner. It really does make me a better person knowing that the vacuum will be out. I pick up and put away. I make beds and do dishes. Getting the floors clean just starts the process to make the whole house look great. If you have small kiddos with toys, or you have a house with a lot of junk all over, this is not your tool. If you like vacuum marks perfectly put in the carpet with straight lines, clean look, Better Homes and Garden kept home, you better buy this.
customer_reviews.author: Marie Phipps

customer_reviews.title: A piece of junk DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: This machine has been nothing but one long headache. It continuously forgets to go back to the charging station and you have to have an all out hunt to find it. It is constantly getting clogged and as a result generates an error message that it is full. It also routinely malfunctions in that its sensors detect uneven ground despite being on a solid flat surface. We purchased a competitor brand eufy for a fraction of the cost and could not be happier with the new machine. iRobot is selling a brand and is way over priced. STAY AWAY!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Goldfarb

customer_reviews.title: Beware!!
customer_reviews.text: Received product, no extra filter, batteries, instructions, or documentation. Looked closer at edge brushes and were dirty! Returning fast as obviously used. For that price, you think I could get a new one!
customer_reviews.author: Linda L.

customer_reviews.title: Cleaning Life Changing.
customer_reviews.text: I thought we were clean people. NOT!!! With two small dogs that have minimal shedding I thought the robo vac would be nice to run on weekends as a back up to weekly cleaning. Oh my was I wrong. First pass in our bedroom and the stuff this little guy (Ralphie) picked up was amazing. Cleaned the bin FIVE times. No wonder my husband has asthma. We run the unit all weekend. Easy to set up, programs itself, the app is fabulous. We will be purchasing another unit to work the back of the house. I wish they had a wet vac model.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: picks up pet hair well enough from floor incl carpet. does, rarely, get stuck in odd places. Bin gets full half the time from pet hair before completing job keeping in mind that I have a small space i'm using this in. Bought when on sale but have plans to upgrade to self-emptying model within a few yrs. With a little research it's also possible to connect to homeseer hub for automation control.
customer_reviews.author: aircave

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: I have RA and kept hurting myself on our heavy, awkward vacuum. Enter the Rhoomba. This thing saves me a lot of misery. We set it to run at night three times a week. My husband empties the bin and keeps the parts free from hair. This particular vac maps your room. The invisible boundary that comes with it keeps the vac from going where you don't want it to. But we find that we need two boundaries in this house, so don't be surprised if you need to buy an extra boundary. Our Rhoomba likes to get stuck under the entertainment center. Otherwise, this vac doesn't get stuck, even though it cleans under the furniture. Would recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: tm

customer_reviews.title: Must-Have!
customer_reviews.text: This Roomba has made our life so much easier. We have started using it heavily once we got a dog and it's picking up dog hair like a charm and it's getting rid of all the dirt on the ground. I love the easily accessible app that we can use to turn the Roomba on from everywhere. I also love how easily this vacuum can slide into the charging port. However, one thing I have noticed is that the trash bin gets full easily. You have to always keep an eye out for your Roomba to make sure it isn't full. Besides that, I love this item!
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: product delivered broken
customer_reviews.text: disappointed that I was shipped a product so expensive that no quality control was done before shipping. The base to the charging came broken. The unit can't fit on the base to charge because the bottom where it screws in, the plastic where the screws screw into were all 4 broken. the unit was evidently dropped. Not happy.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Cotten

customer_reviews.title: Update - not so (Great vacuum)
customer_reviews.text: Update. Lasted barely 6 months and keeps giving error 8 to check the bin. I have cleaned this thing until it is spotless and keeps giving the error. Says the bin needs to be replaced. Going through warrantee process now and pray it's not horrible. But why spend $500 on this when you already have to replace major parts after 6 months. And yes...brand new filter and all just to make sure it wasn't that. Love this thing. Four people and four dogs in our house, so floors are constantly dirty...no more. Would have given five stars but half the time it doesn’t return home. But would still buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Philip L.

customer_reviews.title: Roomba Rays performance
customer_reviews.text: I think it works great but my wife is not fully sure since we have to move some rugs and other items as the Roomba will get caught on them. Today for the first time it got stuck under a LR chair and stopped, but with the WIFI comm it told me to fix it. We have 3 cats so the dust bin must be cleaned between charges. It just seems the vacuum pattern is erratic it moves from one area to another with little planning with finishing an area.
customer_reviews.author: BillyBob

customer_reviews.title: Mom loves it!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my mom for Christmas, and let’s say she was totally against it at first. But once she saw how well it works, especially picking up all the dog hair from her black lab on the white tiles, she quickly became a huge fan. She named her Roomba “Jackie”, which I think is really cute. My mom isn’t very tech saavy, but she told me that the vacuum is SUPER easy to use, not nearly as loud as a regular vacuum cleaner, and she has more free time now that she doesn’t have to vacuum as much, and her floors look cleaner.
customer_reviews.author: Karmela Kljajic

customer_reviews.title: Decent Vacuum
customer_reviews.text: The vacuum works well but has some issues. the first is the "bin full" sensor is too sensitive and I have to clean it quite often or the robot thinks it needs to be emptied even when it is empty. The second issue is it seems to have issues in the dark. We set this up to run downstairs at 3am and if the lights are not on it skips entire rooms.
customer_reviews.author: Nick H.

customer_reviews.title: works great. although out of the box
customer_reviews.text: cleaning wise, works great. although out of the box, I had a battery issue, wouldn't show 100%. called tech support. ran some tests, and battery terminals had to be cleaned? then went to 100% should that be the case on a brand new item??? had to go back and forth and a couple of calls so time was wasted but they sent me new battery to "appease" me. good thing they did. haven't used it in 3 days and just checked, battery at 70% and its been sitting on the cradle plugged in all this time. frustrating!
customer_reviews.author: Dao way

customer_reviews.title: The wait was worth it
customer_reviews.text: I have followed roombas since at least 2008, getting excited over each new iteration waiting for them to develop in to a functional tool rather than a gimmick. I finally pulled the trigger on this one and I am please to say I waited just long enough. The 960 is everything I wanted and does a great job keeping the place looking good in between vacuums. Not one to like needless items, but I do love the cleaning maps it sends me. If you were like me waiting on the side lines, jump in, the water is warm!
customer_reviews.author: Sebastian

customer_reviews.title: Complete disappointment
customer_reviews.text: I spent three whole weeks on the phone with iRobot tech support trying to figure out why this wouldn't connect to my wifi. Me: "There must be something wrong with this unit." Them: "No the unit is fine. There must be something wrong with your wifi." Back and forth... 3 whole weeks. Finally I just gave up and sent it back. I just bought the Ecovacs Deebot N79S for $140. Literally within 10 minutes I was connected to the same wifi network. Who's problem is it now??
customer_reviews.author: Katina Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Terrible model
customer_reviews.text: I had an older model that I owned for several years until it finally wore out. I was excited to get a new model. This model Is terrible. It has not completed one cycle since I purchased it. It gets hung up on EVERYTHING. I do not leave items on my floor. It gets hung on corners or couches and recliners. I have a thin rug that is taped down to my wood floors with rug tape. It hangs on the rug when there is nothing to get hung on. I am very disappointed. I will not buy another. I literally get a notification daily saying that it is hung and have to locate it when I get home.
customer_reviews.author: Scpud

customer_reviews.title: User-Friendly Software, Efficient, Intelligent.
customer_reviews.text: If you’re going to get a Roomba, get a version with machine learning. I had the cheaper version (690) without machine learning, and the 960 is vastly superior. The 690 would, more or less, get stuck cleaning a small area. It was nowhere near as efficient, as the 960. With the machine learning feature, the 960 maps you apartment and becomes more and more efficient cleaning your home. Do yourself a favor, and spend a little extra to get the 960. You won’t regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Alex L.

customer_reviews.title: Gertrude died before returning "Home" on her "maiden voyage".... Sad
customer_reviews.text: We named our Roomba "Gertrude". She ran for about an hour and picked up a fairly good amount of dust and dirt. When she started running low on power, she headed back to her docking station which was out in the open, along a wall in the living room. She almost made it, but died before she could get to her docking station. This happened on the very first time we used it! Not very promising!
customer_reviews.author: E. Scott

customer_reviews.title: Love our Roomba
customer_reviews.text: I had one of the earlier models of this vacuum years ago. It was a nightmare to clean-with bristle brushes. This model has rubber rollers instead. It does a great job. The only thing I ever complain about is that it sometimes gets stuck on the edge of rugs. It is a workhorse. Even when I think my floors are already clean, it will pick up dust I haven’t seen. Love that it goes under the furniture. It seems to have a much more logical movement pattern than the one before which meandered around the house. Love it. I am very happy with this model, although it was very confusing when comparing the various features of different models.
customer_reviews.author: Bev

customer_reviews.title: EXPENSIVE. Vacuums Pretty Well, Dustbin Parts Break Very Quickly
customer_reviews.text: I have two Roombas. They save me enough time that I bought a second one. That said, they are very expensive, the dustbin parts break very quickly, and the WiFi has never worked for me (I have and use WiFi throughout two homes with many devices no problem, but not Roomba). My first Roomba's dustbin door latch broke within the first month, and my second Roomba's removable dustbin filter removal pull tab fell off within the first month.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Brown

customer_reviews.title: I recommend that you are around during the charging phase as ...
customer_reviews.text: I call mine Ralph. He's a work horse. The vacuum pattern is very organized and thorough. He plugged himself in and finished the job after he was recharged to vacuum my 2300 sq. ft. house. I recommend that you are around during the charging phase as the dust bin must be cleaned out. I tried letting him go again without emptying the bin and there were remnants of the bin around the house. Not Ralph's fault. I was told on the app to empty the bin. 😊
customer_reviews.author: Donna B.

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price
customer_reviews.text: I was excited for the roomba after reading reviews and I know we have a larger space and dog hair, but in the first couple of days we had problem after problem. The sensors needed cleared frequently and the roller had to be cleaned a couple of times. With our dog hair the roomba filled up fast / before the job could be finished so the real answer is the newer version with the autodump but that was hundreds more. It picked up things pretty well but with all of the problems not worth that price tag.
customer_reviews.author: M. Weber

customer_reviews.title: Much better than my last robot vacuum
customer_reviews.text: I had a competitor's brand robot vac for a few years, and got tired of getting it unstuck on the edges of rugs. I bought this one and it's been much easier. It has only gotten stuck once under a couch, and it navigates much better than the last one. The one feature I wish it had (I know it's technically possible) is to have it clean certain rooms (like the kitchen) instead of the entire floor. This vacuum maps out the floor plan so it knows where it is, so having it clean certain rooms seems like a feature that should be possible.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Marti

customer_reviews.title: Not for pet hair
customer_reviews.text: All this thing did was collect the pet hair into clumps and leave them all over the floor. It looked worse every time after it was done than before it started.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Not efficient product
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for my mom and her opinion was not good about the robot vacuum cleaner because of its suction power and deep cleaning feature.When you start it to use it cannot reach every point in your house and it does not recognize some places easily and there were always some dust, hairs something like that.I was expecting from the robot vacuum cleaner had a strong suction power but it had not.I'm little bit disappointed but if anyone tries to use it, it could be tried at least.
customer_reviews.author: Enes Kon

customer_reviews.title: Great improvement over my last roomba
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to get a new model since the old one still worked but I really like the improvements. The tracking is better and the new style brushs don't get tangles with pet hair and the clean better. Also the wifi and the app are cool and the Echo integration is nice. I named it after my ex wife so I can just say "Alexa tell **** to clean" and she does. Does a great job and no back talk. :-)
customer_reviews.author: MANOWAR©

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little vacuum
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this 960 for pet hair on our hardwood floors. It does an amazing job keeping the pet hair cleaned up. You will still need to sweep the hardwoods once a week to get all the hard to get areas. This thing actually does pretty good on carpets as well, but our main use is hardwoods. The only thing I can complain about is having to clean the small bin out everyday, sometimes we forget and the vacuum will shut down until you clean it. Battery life is ok. It can not clean my entire floor plan (2700 sq ft) in one cleaning, it must return and recharge before completion. Overall very happy!
customer_reviews.author: David Macheel

customer_reviews.title: Better cleaning, seldom gets stuck, easier to clean.
customer_reviews.text: Bought our second Roomba, a 650, from Amazon in 2013 and it has worked OK but seems to be growing old. Found a refurb 960 in the Amazon Warehouse and sure glad we upgraded. Much better vacuum, much easier to clean, and much more efficient process. The wall-to-wall carpet even *looks* better with tidy linear paths instead of the old random streaks. WiFi, Alexa, and mobile phone connections are handy too. Bottom line: the 960 sucks as well as a traditional vacuum and cleans more thoroughly.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Harnish

customer_reviews.title: Max is on the job!
customer_reviews.text: My Roomba 960 (whom I named Max) is just great. I have it set to vacuum on a preset schedule three times a week. I don't even worry about being home to monitor it. I don't have pets and have white tile floors. But I'm always amazed at the amount of dust that accumulates in dust bin of the unit after it finishes. The unit moves from room to room without a problem and cleans under the bed and other furniture which is absolutely great. Long live Max.
customer_reviews.author: thebookaneer

customer_reviews.title: What hair!
customer_reviews.text: My Lionhead Rabbit sheds like crazy and his hair is so light weight that it flys through the air. But once it settles my Roomba gets it up thoroughly! If I use Roomba before the family comes for Sunday dinner, the alergic ones will not suffer. That is how good this machine is. I gave it 4 Stars, but if I had bought the one with the auto-cleaning stand, where the dirt get dumped automatically, I would have given it 5 Stars. I get irritated hauling it to the other room to dump it. I use it at least three times a week, often more.
customer_reviews.author: Lu

customer_reviews.title: Decent, but don't give up your regular vacuum.
customer_reviews.text: Does a good job on hardwood and ceramic tile floors. So so on carpet, doesn't pick up pet hair that great, balls it up and leaves clumps behind. Doesn't pick up small debris (grass, etc.) that the mutts bring in and leave in the carpet. I like the way it will go back and charge and then finish. It will help with the eternal battle against the dirt 4 stupid dogs bring in from outside, but it is not a substitute for regular vacuuming.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customeri

customer_reviews.title: Giving this a 3 stars because the kids like staring at it
customer_reviews.text: Giving this a 3 stars because the kids like staring at it. It must be good for something because there are a lot of positive reviews. I have failed to get the suckbot to do a complete pass on the main floor of my home. It keeps getting lost and starts going back and forth over the same area over and over and over. When the battery runs out, half the time it just stops in the middle of the hallway and doesn't return to home. Nobody is picking it up and moving it, so you'd think it could figure out where it started and go back.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Johnson

customer_reviews.title: New hard pickup rollers not so good
customer_reviews.text: The new design stiff pickup rollers just did not work on an uneven hard floor or at the edge of a rug on a hard floor . the old brush roller works better. The scanning pattern also does not seem to be as effective as the one in the 690 which I ordered to replace the 960. The 960 also would hangup more often than the 690. It is a bit taller and that made a difference in some tight overhead clearance areas. Buy a 690.
customer_reviews.author: zip

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase I've made all year
customer_reviews.text: Let me start by saying that I have waited to buy the Roomba for more than a year. I just couldn't stomach paying so much for a vacuum cleaner, especially when I have a house full of hardwood floors. Now that I finally have it, you couldn't pry it out of my cold dead hands. This thing is my new best friend!!! We have two large dogs that shed like crazy and one cat. I was vacuuming every other day with my regular stick vacuum and still couldn't keep up. The Roomba has changed all that. I have it set to run every night at 11pm. My floors are finally clean on a daily basis.
customer_reviews.author: steph2135

customer_reviews.title: So far we are liking it.
customer_reviews.text: With two long haired adults, a collie and a long haired cat, this Roomba 960 is proving a game changer for keeping the house much cleaner - particularly free of hair. We have a 1200 square foot single floor home with both hard floors and short pile wall-to-wall carpeting and one area rug with a fringe. It navigates over all surfaces well. We run it twice a week. The first time we ran it, it filled the dirt bin twice. Now it takes a couple of cleanings to fill the bin. The dog and cat both ignore it.
customer_reviews.author: Frumious

customer_reviews.title: Convenient, good for daily cleaning. Eats cables.
customer_reviews.text: It's fantastic. You will need to wrap up cables and surge protectors, basically anything on the floor at it gets stuck in random stuff. It will jump over a thick cable or table leg, but get stuck on a small wire or thread. I love the ability to use remotely and seems like after the initial few cleaning you don't need to change the dust/ waste bin that often. One thing I wish I'd thought of was the need for virtual walls. You get one included. For an average to large size space, you'll probably want to buy 2 more walls minimum too prevent your vacuum getting stuck in certain areas.
customer_reviews.author: Harrison Y.

customer_reviews.title: Love Our Roomba
customer_reviews.text: Didn't know how dirty our floors were until we got this girl. Like others we have named our little cleaner and she is a wonderful addition to the household. We have three cats and the amount of hair collected is amazing. It was so easy to set up a cleaning schedule and away our Roomba goes. Sometimes experiences problems docking but that is not really an issue since it is at the end of a cleaning cycle. Would definitely recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: R Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Eats Rugs!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 960 and the 690. The 690 is way better. The 960 continuously eats rugs, gets stuck on them, and turns off waiting for help. The 690 is able to work with and on rugs much better. It only rarely gets stuck on them, but the 960 is constantly getting stuck on them. What a headache! So if you have bathroom rugs, kitchen rugs, and/or area rugs skip the 960 and go for the 690.
customer_reviews.author: amulet

customer_reviews.title: A must have!
customer_reviews.text: If you don’t have a Roomba yet, I highly recommend one! I had an older model before getting this one, and I’m so glad I made the upgrade. The suction power on this one is a million times better than my previous one. I have three large dogs and a 4 year old so having a Roomba is a complete lifesaver. It picks up dog hair, Cheerios, and any other small things that need to be sucked up, leaving my floors spotless. Once it is done cleaning, it goes right back to its charging station. It’s cleaning compartment is simple and easy to dump out the debris as well.
customer_reviews.author: Russell Lance Garner Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed
customer_reviews.text: I had no idea these things were so thorough. I run it twice a week on my wood floors and I can tell a huge difference. No grit , no fuzziness on my feet. Nothing . I keep running it and it keeps filling itself up. House is practically dust free. My only complaint is the preparation before it runs so it does not snag on area rugs or get stuck behind a door. It's trial and error the first few times and then it's just a few minutes or prep before each scheduled run.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Ewing

customer_reviews.title: We have time for other things.
customer_reviews.text: My wife asked why am I starting this today she just vacuumed. After 20 minutes the bin was saying its full. We couldn't believe what was in it... Also it goes under beds and other furniture. Worth every penny we use it 3 times a week and without any effort on our part just open the app and start. Dogs don't get freaked out they just move.. Hard wood. Area rugs and ceramic tile in the bathroom. All done it 2 charges around 1700 sq ft. Thank you for my time back. When are you making a lawnmower??
customer_reviews.author: Svetlana Riha

customer_reviews.title: Not for shepherd fur
customer_reviews.text: Did everything Roomba said to do.... Emptied the dust bin numerous times but my carpets- low to medium pile have streaks of fur the Roomba will not pick up. Vacuumed with regular vacuumed the numerous streaks of fur and 24 hours later ran the Roomba- more streaks of fur... Again vacuumed those and ran Roomba again- more streaks of fur. My two senior shepherds are brushed everyday 20-30 minutes each with several types of brushes including a furminator... The rollers will not pick up their fur from carpets only hard surfaces. Will be returning...
customer_reviews.author: sandra hebert

customer_reviews.title: You will be happy you bought it!
customer_reviews.text: I have wanted a roomba for years!!! It was always just out of our price range. I watched the price fuculate for a year before I finally bought it. I couldn’t be happier with it!! It saves me so much time! It cleans the floors while I wash the dishes! It’s not too loud, I am able to watch tv or talk on the phone with not on. It’s super gross to clean out the dust bin and realize how gross the floors are and I run it everyday!
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Returning
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this product hoping it would allow me to not have to vacuum every day. We have a 1400 sq. ft. home and 3 dogs. I never intended for the Roomba to keep my home spotless but it was pretty worthless. It always got clogged, would not charge properly, etc. It seemed like everytime I went to use it, it had an error (some were my fault; forgot to empty the bin). Returning for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Linsey M. White

customer_reviews.title: Needs additional development
customer_reviews.text: We set-up the robot provided from it's brand new box. It did not work and produced an error message indicating that it was not operational. We contacted the manufacturer who offered to send us a replacement part which apparently was the source of the error message . We declined, since it is not the customer's role to fix the faulty item. The price was refunded, and we purchased a Shark cordless vacuum which worked out well.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Clausewitz

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this two years ago and it’s still going strong. My only complaint is that when you end the cycle, it kind of has a moment of derp where it just won’t go back to the base. It goes EVERYWHERE but there, but after 15 minutes, it might find the base. Other than that, still five stars. The tumbleweeds of dog hair no longer exist in our house and it’s great to run while you’re cleaning other stuff around the house.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: “Why didn’t you just go HOME? That’s your HOME! Are you too good for your HOME? ANSWER ME!”
customer_reviews.text: Seems to have a problem finding its home when it is done, not sure why this happens pretty frequently... Tells me that the bin is full way too often when it isn't, apparently you need to clean the sensors behind the bin frequently. Otherwise, this thing is a life saver because my dog sheds like crazzzzyyyyyy. Great investment
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love the Roomba 960
customer_reviews.text: Great improvement over the 600 series I had! Does a much better job. It has rollers instead of brushes. I no longer have to dig dog hair out of the brushes weekly!! The only downsides are battery life is about half of the 600, but she returns to the charging station and due to mapping, when charged returns to complete the job & although I get notified on my phone that the dust bin needs to be emptied, I wish there was an audible (beep, etc) to get my attention DOES A GREAT JOB
customer_reviews.author: fullerton

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I wish it would run on radar instead of camera so that it could run at night like neato and it would be able to see better my dark furniture. I had a neato before and it would get stuck between dining chairs, so, bought a roomba now. I also bought roomba instead of neato because roomba has 1 year warranty on batteries. Neato only 6 months. But, I wish this roomba’s battery would last longer than 75 min. Neato’s D5 lasts 90 minutes. Overall I’m happy with the product because it doesn’t get stuck between chairs and never fails to return to its base (unlike my old neato).
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Favela Tentori

customer_reviews.title: I Love this thing
customer_reviews.text: I Love this thing. Thought I lived clean, have housekeepers and steam cleaner, but I started this robot and she has been non-stop. I have to clean the filter and bin quite often. I have two small shedding dogs. She has been busy going under the beds and some furniture, I suspect that is where some of the fur/dirt is filling up the bin. Yes, I have to move things around a bit when she is busy but seriously, how hard is that? Just move and watch TV. Dogs are a little freaked out, but not so much. And when she is tired, she goes to base station and recharges, then is back at it.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn

customer_reviews.title: Love this Roomba!
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if previous reviews were problems that have been fixed, but this machine is an excellent robot vacuum. I bought this for my elderly parents who are not incompacitated but just not able to push a vacuum all over their large house. Their home has hardwood floors, carpet, several kinds of area rugs and a dog who is outside as much as he is inside. The Roomba 960 picks up all reasonable size items on the floor and does a great job picking up pet hair. UPDATE: after 3 months it’s still running well and I’ve notice a huge reduction of debris on my HVAC filters. We attribute that to the ability to vacuum more often with Roomba.
customer_reviews.author: 0010girl

customer_reviews.title: Scratches Hardwood Floors.
customer_reviews.text: This iRobot’s is scratching my brand new dark hardwood floors. We have no dog, no kids at home anymore so we installed dark hardwood flooring in the entire upstairs except bathrooms. Slowly over the last 12 months we now see the scratch marks in patterns from the iRobot. We only use it once or twice a month. Now trying to get my floors fixed but that’s proving to difficult.
customer_reviews.author: Robert HArris

customer_reviews.title: LOVING THIS THING
customer_reviews.text: I SET IT TO CLEAN EVERY NIGHT AT 11. IT IS AMAZING WHAT IS CLEANS UP THAT CAN'T BE SEEN. DEFINITELY WORTH THE MONEY. AFTER FIRST CLEANING, I ONLY HAVE TO EMPTY BIN EVERYOTHER DAY OR TWO. HAVE HAD NO PROBLEMS WITH IT. NOTE: DON'T LET KIDS SIT ANYTHING IN FRONT OF STOP SENSOR, ROOMBA DROVE DOWN THE HALL AND MADE IT TO LAUNDRY ROOM WHERE IT TRIED TO SUCK UP A SOCK. MADE A TON OF NOISE AND KNOCKED OVER THE BROOM. ALMOST SHOT THE ROOMBA. THE STOP SENSOR IS IMPORTANT TO KEEP ROOMBA WHERE IT IS MEANT TO BE.
customer_reviews.author: Mary B.

customer_reviews.title: You actually need one of these
customer_reviews.text: OK, I have to say, for a long time I thought who the hell needs an expensive robot that can't make a good margarita. We have pets, my wife sweeps multiple times a day. I bit the bullet, not expecting much. I WAS WRONG!!!! This machine makes sweeping the main areas of the house a thing of the past. Sure, there are places that it can't get to, but a vacuum hose once a week and a bit of sweeping takes care of what is missed. Best investment for house cleaning that we've ever made.
customer_reviews.author: Buddy H.

customer_reviews.title: It does the job
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to setup with the app. I like the app because it allows you to schedule the cleaning. We have a dog and the dirt tray is full of dog hair every time it runs so it must be working. We have all tile floors with a few area rugs. I like it, one less thing I have to do. It seems to be pretty good at finding it's way back to the charging station and will run about an hour on a charge. By the time it needs to charge it also needs to be emptied. I had it run every day the first week but have now cut it back to 3 x/week. It's a keeper.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Shrimplin

customer_reviews.title: Expect to clean up after it if you have dogs
customer_reviews.text: Navigation is very good, and it rarely gets stuck (but occasionally does). The mapping feature displaying where it worked is very nice. The dust bin is still quite small, needing to be emptied several times while working my house (largely due to dog hair). In some cases the rollers clump up dog hair and leave it behind on rugs so that I have to walk around and pick up (or vacuum up with a handheld) the leavings. Still, it's worth running (if debatable whether it's worth the price).
customer_reviews.author: T. Westberg

customer_reviews.title: We name her Betsy the robot :)
customer_reviews.text: we name her betsy. Betsy gets stuck every once in awhile on our son's toys or play mats if we leave them out which is understandable but she's doing a pretty good job keeping up with the cleaning we don't have time for during work. sometimes she is disorganized in her location and goes all over which seems inefficient but whatever. as long as she gets most of it I am ok. also love seeing my cat freak out. and the app is very handy to program and get updates about what is going on. Do wish it said where she is stuck with gps coordinates but that is probably too much for the price haha.
customer_reviews.author: S. schaum

product_meta.title: iRobot Roomba 960 Robot Vacuum- Wi-Fi Connected Mapping, Works with Alexa, Ideal for Pet Hair, Carpets, Hard Floors,Black
product_meta.description: Style:Roomba 960The Roomba 960 robot vacuum seamlessly navigates room to room to clean an entire level of your home, recharging and resuming until the job is done. Roomba 960 loosens, lifts, and suctions dirt with up to 5x more air power and requires less maintenance. Just press CLEAN or schedule Roomba on the go with the iRobot HOME App.
feature_bullets: IT WON'T STOP TILL THE JOB IS DONE - Intelligently maps & cleans an entire level of your home. Patented iAdapt technology with vSLAM navigation actively captures thousands of precise measurements each millisecond to optimize coverage.
NAVIGATES IN NEAT ROWS - Purposefully & logically cleans in neat rows & uses floor tracking sensors to navigate your home.

IDEAL FOR HOMES WITH PETS - Unique Dual Multi-Surface Rubber Brushes don't get tangled with pet hair. Brushes adjust & flex to stay in constant contact with carpets & hard floors. High-Efficiency Filter traps 99% of cat & dog allergens.
LEARNS YOUR LIFE LISTENS TO YOUR VOICE - Learns your cleaning habits to offer up personalized schedules, while Google Assistant & Alexa allow you to start cleaning with just the sound of your voice.
SENSES & ELIMINATES DIRT - Dirt Detect Sensors alert your robot about dirtier areas of your home, like high-traffic spots, & cleans them more thoroughly.
THE DREAM TEAM OF CLEAN - With Imprint Link, when the Roomba 960 finishes vacuuming, it automatically tells Braava jet m6 to start mopping.
PICKS UP RIGHT WHERE IT LEFT OFF - Doesn’t skip a beat, or a mess. When its running low on battery it recharges & resumes, ensuring a complete clean.

iRobot does not certify the quality or authenticity of products purchased from non-authorized resellers, & will not cover claims, provide service or offer replacements for products purchased from these sellers.
POWERFUL PERFORMANCE AND POWERFUL PICK-UP - Power-Lifting Suction delivers 5X the air power for improved pick-up performance.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars6,208 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
specifications.Included Components: 1 Dual Mode Virtual Wall® Barrier - 1 Extra AeroForce® High-Efficiency Filter - 1 Extra Side Brush - 1 Home Base® Charging Station - 1 Line Cord - Owner’s Guide - Documentation Package
